$description: This is a parent label which is meant to classify the document. As general data is the most used data during work, we need to treat it according to what it is meant for. To protect it accordingly we use sublabels.

Settings.Value:
Confidential data is classified as all business information that poses a risk to the company if it is made generally public. Confidential information should only be accessible to a restricted group of people. In addition to internal information, this also applies to all customer-related information.

[Note]:
Publication of this data may entail financial or business-damaging risks!

[Examples]:
Information subject to company secrecy
Projects won with customer and order data
Bids and contracts
All customer-related data, including. including a customer's infrastructure concerning
Lists or evaluations with customer data 
Documents intended for or originating from customers or suppliers
Business data, including balance sheets and profit figures, legal documents, audit reports
